landlord_tenant_relationship.reasoning: Complaint alleges a lease, the plaintiff is a tenant at 45 Willow Street since Jan. 1, 2022, pays monthly rent to Defendant, and identifies Defendant as the landlord (¶¶2–5, 22).

act_or_omission_by_landlord.reasoning: Complaint alleges specific landlord conduct: Defendant spoke to the upstairs tenants once but failed to take effective remedial action and explicitly refused to intervene, stating he “can’t control how people live” (¶¶12–14, 25). This pleads an omission/failure to act.

substantial_interference.reasoning: Complaint alleges ongoing, excessive and unreasonable noise (stomping, loud music, furniture dragging at late hours) from the unit above, and expressly alleges this noise is a substantial and continuing interference with use and enjoyment; it also pleads concrete effects (chronic sleep deprivation, medical treatment, workplace warning) supporting substantiality (¶¶9–10, 15–18, 26).

causation.reasoning: Complaint alleges Defendant was given repeated notice of the disturbance (¶12), had the opportunity/duty to act (¶24), failed to take reasonable steps (¶13, 25), and that his failure allowed the continuing interference—linking the landlord’s omission to the continued deprivation of quiet enjoyment (¶¶12–14, 24–26).

damages.reasoning: Complaint pleads actual damages: sleep deprivation, medical expenses for prescribed sleep medication ($40/month), workplace written warning, out-of-pocket mitigation expenses (earplugs, white-noise machine), reduced enjoyment, and estimates total damages of $2,400 (¶¶15–19, 27).
